    • Method Detail

      • BlurData

        public static float[] BlurData(float[] data,
                               int radius)
        Applies a one-dimensional gaussian blur to the array, to remove jumps between values. The original array is not changed.
        Parameters:
        data - The source data, which is blurred.
        radius - The radius of the blur. Maximum is the half of the data array length
        Returns:
        A new array with the blur applied to the source data.

      • normalizeText

        public static java.lang.String normalizeText(java.lang.String text)
        Replaces all umlauts with roman letters
        • = ae
        • = ue
        • = oe
        Parameters:
        text - The text to replace the umlauts
        Returns:
        A text without umlauts

      • clamp

        public static int clamp(int value,
                        int min,
                        int max)
        Clamps a value to a certain range.

        Examples:

        • clamp(4,0,5) = 4
        • clamp(-2,-1,3) = -1
        • clamp(100,10,50) = 50
        Parameters:
        value - The value to clamp
        min - The minimum value of the result.
        max - The maximum value of the result.
        Returns:
        The value if it is within the given range. Else the bounds are returned.
